data.title: Great Pizza by the slice or the pie!
data.text: A great place for a quick bite.  Excellent thin crust pizza, made fresh and piping hot.  Not a fancy location, but there is both indoor and outdoor seating.  Soda fountain or bottled beer available.

data.title: Worst Deal Ever!
data.text: Went there, got stale pizza, bad attitude, way overpriced. Totally felt ripped off. The best Brunos' is the one over on Edison just past Grape, past Barnabys'. All Brunos' are not alike. This one really blows!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: Yummmm
data.text: If you like pizza this is the place to go. It is fair priced and very good. There are TVs throughout the restaurant if you like to watch the games.

data.title: Its the pizza.
data.text: On a prime corner in doentown South Bend, Bruno's makes no attempt to be anything other than a pizza place with some booths and tables.  The pizzas come in thin crust, regular and thick crust o suit one's taste.  A cosmopolpitan traditional was excellent, but seemed to be heavy on the salt.  I was thirsty for hours.  A decent selection of beers and some wines are available but it is not the kind of atmosphere where one feels inclined to linger.

data.title: Best Pizza Hands Down
data.text:
We arrived at Brunos after a long day in the car.  My husband is a ND grad and we were in town for the upcoming day.

The folks were so very nice.  They were very patient with our not so happy 3 year old and mildly cranky 1 year old.

The food is wonderful.  We had bread sticks and bruschetta and a pizza with everything.  The pizza was incredible.

I highly recommend.
